column4: guys there's any problem if i try to compile my own kernel under ubuntu?
I woudn't recommend it
other distros such as Gentoo sure, but Ubuntu no
why?
because Ubuntu isn't really the type of distro where people tend to compile their own kernels if at all
ikonia: but there's anything from ubuntu that gonna lock me of this?
why do you want to compile yoru own?
to optimize my kernel
if you want more control of your technical system under the hood,  Ubuntu probably isn't really the correct distro
Ubuntu's kernel should be fine,   unless maybe your going to do something really fancy that requires some other kernel
by the way
Ubuntu only releases security updates,   well there are some ppa for some apps.  for later stuff yes  you would need a later version of Ubuntu
where as other distros are more cutting edge
hmm understood
just out of curiosity why did you want to compile yoru own anyway?
to make it more faster having only things that i need
get  Jaunty when it's released and do Ext4 and you got faster
April yeah
jaunty = the next ubuntu version?
yes the next Ubuntu version
default is Ext3, but it has Ext4 support
yep probably
not much suppourt for Ext4?????
